content.description:
Killer route - overhanging and pumpy with a smorgasbard of all kind of holds from crimps to sidepulls to pockets to slopers.

Start up the dicey beginning moves (11a) to the first bolt (about 12 feet up).  You may want to stick clip the first bolt - I didn't have a stick but I was wishing I did.   There are a couple of places where you can hook a heel around the arete - other than that you won't get much rest.

A series of hard-to-see holds lead to a bomber sidepull seam.   Casting off from there is hard to do- you won't want to leave this great hold.

Slopers lead to the chains.  Fun!
content.location: The crag is split by a big dihedral.   Left of the dihedral is a nice sport route.  Superchunk is the next route left of there, on the arete.   It starts out on the overhanging wall just behind the tree.

content.description:
Fun and burly with immaculate stone.

Climbs up a slightly overhanging wall on beautiful edges - very continuous.

The very last move is the crux - throw left to a crummy sloper and attempt to match on this- then up to the anchors.

A local called this route by another name, but I am not 100% sure what he called it "Worth a Squeeze", or something like that?  So it may have another alias.

50 feet long, this is the longest and probably hardest route at the crag.   Vies with Superchunk for the best route here.
content.location: Between Superchunk and the dihedral - striking line and hard to miss.

content.description:
Fun route on really nice varied stone.  I can't quite locate the 10a move - this route may be easier than Chunky Monkey (5.9) just to its left.

The rock quality is a real highlight - great stone!
content.location: This is 2 routes right of the big dihedral, just right of Chunky Monkey.

content.description: Climb slopey face, seems pretty mellow, might want to think about longer quick draws, as the route wanders a little bit.
content.location: 50 feet right of Hasta la Vista, Baby.

content.description:
Decent route that meanders up a face between the Red Dog mini-dihedral and the better Hot Buttered Soul.

Nothing too remarkable about this route, but it goes up some nice holds and has some interesting moves.
content.location: Between Red Dog and Hot Buttered Soul, the second route in from the right side.

content.description:
This route goes up a small dihedral, just right of Slippery Avocado.   All the tricky climbing is located down low in surmounting the first semi-chossy roof near the first bolt.

After that it gets pretty easy.

Unfortunately, the route was bolted like you would be left in the dihedral.  The actual climbing takes you a bit right of this over the roof.  So the bolting is a little funky at the first bolt and threatens to slap you against the wall if you fall.

After getting through this funkiness it is 5.8 to the anchors.  Not a terrible route but a route I would not recommend - just not as good as the other lines here.
content.protection: 5 bolts to the Slippery Avocado anchor.

content.description:
Worthwhile route, although most of the best climbing is over in about 15 feet.

A bouldery, reachy start leads to a jug and a critical clip.   Then it is just 5.10 to the anchors.

Not nearly as good as Superchunk, but worthwhile if you are there.
content.location: This route is the furthest right route on the wall.
Route begins in dihedral, then traverses left under bulge and up through groove. Left side of Love Shack

content.description:
Fun liebacks and fingerlocks on slick stone. Â Great stances and plentiful

gear, well suited for the beginner trad climbers.
content.protection: Nuts or BD cams .3-2.  Shares chain anchors with Chunky Monkey
content.location: Obvious corner in the middle of the Live Shack

content.description:
Pretty nice route for the grade - climbing is generally very continuous and the moves seem to stack up pretty well.

No moves harder than 5.9, but not many easier than that either.

Nicely textured stone.
content.location: This is the first route right of the prominent dihedral.
